Articles.Content:
Build your fully constructed antenna below 'the Node,' then rotate it to the side.

Thanks, that fixed the solar panel attachment issue, but now the strut wants to attach to the node so that it\'s inside it. Oh well, I guess the game just isn\'t meant to work with sideways attachments.

Humorous.

Winglet problems? I haven\'t had any with my newest aircraft builds when it came to symmetry... how detailed are the pieces in terms of how many pieces does it take to get to the center?

I think the problem he\'s talking about is landing gear. We don\'t have bilateral symmetry, so you have to 'eyeball' where the wheels go on wings.
Is it possible to make a 1m version of the BACE parts? They just fit so awful with the other parts I have cause they\'re not quite 1.5

I think the problem he\'s talking about is landing gear. We don\'t have bilateral symmetry, so you have to 'eyeball' where the wheels go on wings.

Oh yeah right, I just usually put them on a certain place on a texture I can recognize.

Going to port this to KSP once I get it fully modeled and textured:

(Real world scale depicted, will be 2m in KSP)

Something weird as hell just happened with one of the lander legs from silisko edition. The wider of the 2 is attaching fine in the VAB, but on spawn, it\'s inside the tank it\'s attached to, then still inside it when I go back to the VAB.

I tried to check the narrower one, but it refuses to attach at all.
The ones in the second pack aren\'t included in SE anymore, Tiberion is using them with NovaPunch.
OK, I never bothered downloading SE 1.2.

Does porting some of your Orbiter creations into KSP mean that we\'ll also be graced with the Sparrow Orbital Outpost? In any case, wonderful work so far and I\'m looking forward to what you\'ll create in the future.
What about that N-1.

Going to port this to KSP once I get it fully modeled and textured:

(Real world scale depicted, will be 2m in KSP)

Very nice. Will it use normally balanced KSP data values for thrust, fuel, and such? I would love to be able to use some of those parts on other rockets as well.

Very nice. Will it use normally balanced KSP data values for thrust, fuel, and such? I would love to be able to use some of those parts on other rockets as well.

I\'m going to make two versions. Vanilla balanced, and SE balanced.

As for the N1, it will come eventually, but it\'s not a top priority right now.

Very nice. Will it use normally balanced KSP data values for thrust, fuel, and such? I would love to be able to use some of those parts on other rockets as well.

I\'m guessing the silisko edition project has been shelved. Maybe we\'ll get something like SIDR 2
Making an optical telescope for BACE, after this, a radio telescope.

Making an optical telescope for BACE, after this, a radio telescope.

AWESOME! I\'d been planning on dropping probodobodyne dishes on legs around, I don\'t doubt these will be way better.

All your BACE are belong to us?

Seriously, glad to see you back. And making more top-quality parts, too.
Nice work on the telescope Nova. Can\'t wait for next release!
From that picture, it looks like the secondary mirror is facing outward; is this supposed to be the case, or is it doubled on the inside of the brace somewhere I can\'t see it?

From that picture, it looks like the secondary mirror is facing outward; is this supposed to be the case, or is it doubled on the inside of the brace somewhere I can\'t see it?

I\'ve fixed that already =p
This looks boss makes me want animation this update.
I feel the burn of making this. But I shall not stop until I make the radio telescope aaaaaaaaaa
can\'t wait! All these look great. I;m going to make a huge base on the big equatorial lightside crater
*mobster accent* You have 1934 posts, eh, see?

The telescope looks like it\'s coming along great.

Are you making a decoupler to go under the BACE engine? All bar the nano are blocked by the legs.
